reviewText: This game is a proof of concept.  Let's start with the controls, there are options when you start the game to change your steering, obvious right?  Of course.... They were set to S and F...  Looking further, there were no accelerate and brake controls, only fly height + and fly height - options which were set to E and D.  My hopes that this would be a well made megarace-like experience were quietly taken behind the barn and shot.  Despite this, I pressed on.\n\nI will not be mentioning anything about multiplayer, because i couldn't find anyone to play with, so... yeah.  The single player campaigns 'story' is pretty basic, something about enforcing things after nukes blah blah, which I can forgive, it was a ~1.76 when i bought it and I bought it because I wanted to shoot things.  (I saw gun barrels on the car, sue me).  As soon as the first loading screen for the first 'race' took place, I was informed that I didn't need to accelerate or brake
date: the car will do that for me."  This was when my previously mentioned hopes were dug up
hoursPlayed: and thrown back in the hole.\n\nYou can only steer
helpfulPercent: and press space to fly.  While flying
votesTotal: but before you get your hopes up
votesFunny: I feel I need to mention that the mouse doesn't aim your weapons... at all
column16: while bullets can fire ~20 degrees out of your gun
column17: you can't aim them yourself.  Now you may think that such a wide cone would be acceptable if it just aims for you
column18: wrong.  It's finicky sometimes and while im busy steering around trying to get missiles

column22: this game is a proof of concept
column23: but is it worth 3.00 not on sale?  I would say no

reviewText:
4.5/10 - A Tunnel Shooter

You have a fixed speed, either fly over objects or drive under them. Shoot things. Etc. There really isn't much room to move around making it impossible to get creative. Graphics aren't bad. Not worth the price.

Worth $0.50 if you like tunnel shooters

reviewText:
Fire & Forget is a fantastic arcade-style game with retro-style graphics, a fun control system and simple but enjoyable gameplay! I love the arcady feel of the game! The controls are simple and the cars handle well.

This game is especially fun when played with an additional person -- one controlling the mouse and the other playing on keyboard! Forget micro-tranactions, waiting to unlock levels or for your car's fuel to recharge - they simply don't make games like this anymore!

Highly recommended!

reviewText: I vaguely remember playing this game in the late eighties on my commodore 64 so I thought I'd give it a try. The graphics look OK, but enemies all look the same as do the obstacles. There isn't much of a story and the end boss is the same character over and over. There are a few different backgrounds but since they have no impact on gameplay you'll hardly notice that. The gameplay is also very barebones which mirrors the original game but even simple arcade games nowadays offer more. You can earn upgrades by winning coins and the end of each level. But the upgrades are unlocked automatically (you cannot choose how to spent your coins). Most upgrades are cosmetic, different skins that don't chance the gameplay in a meaningful way. It's not really a racing game but more of an on rails shooter since speed is controlled by the game itself and the canon automatically aims towards the nearest enemy. I blasted through the first eight (out of ten) levels on normal difficulty with no difficulty at all and then suddenly hit a wall as the difficulty suddenly spiked in level nine. In the first eight levels there are only few obstacles so it's not very important when you stay on the road and when you take off and fly over obstacles. In level nine you suddenly have to avoid large amounts of obstacles. Since the steering feels unresponsive (I was constantly either understeering or oversteering) the precission that is suddenly required is very annoying. Blasting enemies also isn't very demanding until you're suddenly overwhelmed in the last two levels. All in all it feels rushed, over simplistic and very rough around the edges.\nIt's not exactly a trainwreck of a game and some people might even find it enjoyable to try and get high scores on the leaderboard. But I would rather waste my time on another racing game.
